info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 9:22PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Mineral and southeastern Sanders Counties through 945 PM MDT... At 920 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near St. Regis, or 12 miles northwest of Superior, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... St. Regis. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 32 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
